comment: If you have the chance to take Dr. Ritchie, DO IT. I have taken him two times (for my undergrad and graduate literacy class) and wish I could take him a 3rd time. He is an amazing professor and he cares about the quality of education that you get. If you put in the effort and you will get an A in this course.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: This professor is so easy! He does make you buy a textbook, but it was very helpful and useful. He is realistic and teaches you things that you actually need to know about. This class doesn't have many assignments either. Definitely recommend!

He is very chill and understanding. There is a long reading and reflection every week for the first 12 weeks. It's long but easy. A semester long partner project. And he makes some realllly good guacamole.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Ritchie is by far one of my favorite professors I've had in this program. He is so relatedable and I love participating in his class. Readings/Dicussion are a good bit of work but honestly I actually liked the content and felt it was relavent and useful. The demo lessons was my favorite part of the class, easy but fun! You wont regret it!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Ritchie is a great professor whom I have had the privilege of taking twice. I took him in my undergraduate semester and now as a grad school student. He is very prompt about grading and answering emails and will provide help/feedback whenever needed. He is very caring and a lenient grader. Take him if you can!

Took him for an online summer masculinities class and he was phenomenal. He clearly cares about what he is teaching and weekly assignments are insanely interesting. The documentaries are all incredible and he is just a great professor.
Really easy - a few books need to be purchased. Discussion posts every week, demonstration lessons and one partner/group project. He is super flexible and will work with you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Dr. Ritchie is fabulous. Really teaches you practical and useful things about literacy. Syllabus looked a little scary at first, but don't let that fool you. Readings are helpful, class is interactive, and he creates a really good class environment. Take him. I just really wish I could have taken him for Block II as well.

Professor Ritchie is amazing! I loved his class and he was so stress free. If you need an extension ask him and he'll give you one. He's super helpful and understanding. If you can take him, I highly suggest taking him!

Professor Ritchie was amazing. We did read a lot but the information was somewhat useful. (lol). However, he was very lenient, understanding, and extremely helpful. Definitely take him if you have the chance!!

This class requires lots of reading. Dr. Ritchie is super flexible with dates and really cares about his students. He doesnt like to give extra assignments that arent going to be beneficial to your learning. His classes have no visual aids, which I would have liked to see.

Dr. Ritchie is the only teacher I had this semester that seemed to remember that we are going through life changing world events at the same time as being college seniors. He clearly cares about this students, and stayed open and honest with us. His content isnt hard, but there is a lot of busy work. Definitely worth taking his class though.

Amazing prof. Second time taking him. Only prof that has increased my passion for the field. He introduces some amazing concepts that can really change you as an educator. He gives you great resources and provides in-depth feedback. Super flexible and up for hearing feedback from students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: TAKE. HIM. It doesnt matter what class you take him for you will not regret it. I have taken him twice and I would do it again. He really cares about his students and he realizes that he is not your only class. He is relatable and funny. He makes lesson plans seem not so scary and is one of the 2 professors I actually liked in the education program

Dr. Ritchie was fantastic! He made several videos and audio clips to help with concepts and assignments during the semester. He gave clear feedback on all assignments and wanted us to grow from our errors. I have already signed up for another class with him next semester.

Dr. Ritchie, although having the most work to do this semester, made everything much easier by always offering extensions and being understanding of our stress and lives outside of school. He always allowed us to go back and fix mistakes. I loved the books and articles we read in this class as well. A wonderful professor who knows what he's doing!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Ritchie gives great feedback on assignments to assist you in learning how to become a better teacher. He responds in a timely manner when contacted via email for assistance on assignments as well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is very nice and interesting! He has a lot of personal stories and makes you excited to be a teacher. I would take his class again!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The best teacher ever! TAKE HIM!

One of my favorite teachers at KSU!!! I cannot say enough great things about him. He makes you enjoy reading and want to be the best reading teacher you can be. Makes you actually want to come to class and learn. There is never a wasted class. If I could have him again I would take him! He wants to make you a good teacher! FABULOUS TEACHER!!!

GREAT teacher!! He is so nice and helpful. He treats you like a person instead of just another student in the class who he doesn't care about. He asks what you'd like to learn. He is flexible and gave us practical things to use for teaching. He's awesome!!
